CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an action with the ORG . He claimed that the defendants had lost the right to use a flat .
CARDINAL . The first hearing in the case was held on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , on the applicant 's complaint , ORG found a violation of LAW in respect of the length of the above proceedings . It noted that the case was not complex . The applicant 's conduct had partially contributed to their duration at the initial stage in that he had not paid the court fees at the time of filing the action . ORG was responsible for delays totalling DATE . ORG awarded the applicant CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) ( the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) at that time ) as just satisfaction . It also ordered ORG to reimburse the applicant 's legal costs and to proceed with the case speedily .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found against the applicant .
CARDINAL . The Košice Regional Court , on appeal , quashed the judgment on DATE and remitted the case to ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG asked the defendants and the applicant to submit information and invited several doctors to indicate whether the defendants ' state of health would allow them to attend a hearing . A hearing was held in DATE at which the applicant requested a modification of his action . His request was subsequently rejected .
CARDINAL . ORG found against the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment . After having been served on the parties to the proceedings , the decision became final on DATE .
